edu.ata.automation.dispatch

Class GameMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ata.automation.dispatch.GameMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InterruptableGameMode, UninterruptableAutonomousMode

    public abstract class GameMode
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Basic class representing game modes. Handles running by itself.

    Implemented by running in a new separate thread. Instantiates a new thread each time it is started. This is done because threads are implicitly only runnable once. This creates the need to re-create the Thread object each time. Another bonus of this is that priority of the thread is adjustable between runs if needed. (setPriority(int)).

    Author:
    joel

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameMode

        public GameMode(String name)
        Creates the game mode with a name. Priority is set to Thread.NORM_PRIORITY.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the thread

      • GameMode

        public GameMode(String name,
        int priority)
        Creates the game mode with a name and priority.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the thread
        priority - priority of the thread (1 - 10)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        Gets the name of the thread.
        Returns:
        name of game mode

        Creates a string representation of the thread.

        string representation

      • isAlive

        public final boolean isAlive()
        Checks to see if the thread is still alive. If it is not running / is null / is not registered as 'alive', returns false.
        Returns:
        whether the thread is alive
        See Also:
        Thread.isAlive()

      • start

        public final void start()
        Starts the thread (Game Mode).

        Caution : Thread will not be started if Thread.isAlive() does not return false. This prevents the game mode from running more than once at the same time, but is prone to concurrency problems.

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int priority)
        Sets the priority of the thread. Will take effect the next time you run the game mode. (start())
        Parameters:
        priority - priority of the thread (1-10)
        See Also:
        Thread.setPriority(int)

      • stop

        public abstract void stop()
        Stops the game mode. Is overridden, and thus cannot be entirely trusted.
